lead_paragraph: As President Obama presses for the authority to negotiate new trade deals, Galesburg, Ill., illustrates why some economists have doubts about the effects of more global trade.

headline.print_headline: Town’s Decline Illustrates Peril of Trade Deals
headline.main: Perils of Globalization When Factories Close and Towns Struggle

snippet: As President Obama presses for the authority to negotiate new trade deals, Galesburg, Ill., illustrates why some economists have doubts about the effects of more global trade.
abstract: Decline of Galesburg, Ill, illustrates potentially stark repercussions of globalization as Pres Obama presses Trans-Pacific Partnership and other trade deals; town's population and median income has shrunk dramatically since 1999, reflecting economic recession and closure of Maytag factory that was its largest employer; trend highlights mounting evidence that free trade tends to benefit upper-income households disproportionately, leaving places like Galesburg to reckon with costs.
